title: How many 5 year olds could your main take on in a fight?
body:
Your main is "balanced" to the level that they are at in League, so champs like Sol wouldn't be ridiculously OP. Your main has access to their abilities, as well as any other gimmicks they have in their lore. All champions will tire out eventually, so HP stackers won't be able to fight on forever. Champions made of rock, metal, or other hard substances are also able to take damage from the 5 year olds, albeit less than champions with normal skin.

The 5 year olds will swarm your main, attacking without coordination but always aiming to do damage. They also don't have any sense of fear or self-preservation, so seeing Cho gobble up a few of their friends won't deter them. They come endlessly, so for every 5 year old that falls, another comes to take his place.

How quickly does Karthus's Defile kill the five year olds? If there are like at least two five-year-olds dying per second and they're dying before they reach Karthus, then he's going to be regenerating enough mana from Defile to keep it up indefinitely.
If they're as tough as melee minions at 40 minutes, then Karthus is going to have some problems because his mana is going to run out really quickly.

{{champion:2}}:  Never dies because his destiny is to die outside of combat.  If we're ignoring that, he'd eventually run out of strength/mana and be left without lifesteal, succumbing to his fate.  
~373 five year olds.

~589 five year olds.

~653 five year olds.

{{champion:10}}:  Similar boat to Azir.

{{champion:41}}:  Children would provide excellent farm for his Q so he can upgrade his ult quickly.  GP boasts probably the best AOE waveclear late-game, and like I said, children are easy to farm.  Oranges provide incredible sustain, but that would leave him manaless eventually.  However, Barrels don't cost mana…
~Near infinite number of five year olds.

{{champion:266}} : All of them!
{{champion:61}} : So strange...they scream...

Aatrox and Warwick, though they wouldn't die from damage, would get exhausted eventually. Their attacks will become slower and slower but the 5 year olds will constantly have fresh troops. Even if they kept fighting, the sheer amount of bodies piling up would eventually be enough to crush them.
I guess Warwick could only eat so many.  Ori, on the other hand, could go forever as long as she had room to move and a blue buff.  (kek)

> [{quoted}](name=RAMP Schmidtty,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=cUt8rqIA,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2017-06-28T23:15:34.762+0000)
>
> I guess Warwick could only eat so many.  Ori, on the other hand, could go forever as long as she had room to move and a blue buff.  (kek)

Actually I think she'd have a lot of trouble because her cooldowns wouldn't allow her to kill all the children in time to avoid getting hit. One or two would slip through, especially if she were surrounded, and that would mean that she would eventually go down. If enough five year olds tackled her at once they could also topple her. Aatrox and Warwick would fare better in terms of taking hits, but they would tire out (Warwick first).

With no items, no one fares well.  With full builds, pretty much anyone could except maybe Rakan and Janna.  They aren't built to really kill anything.

Upon consideration, I think Amumu would be the best choice.  The kids would ignore him and leave.

> [{quoted}](name=RAMP Schmidtty,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=cUt8rqIA,comment-id=00030000000000000000,timestamp=2017-06-28T23:58:58.849+0000)
>
> With no items, no one fares well.  With full builds, pretty much anyone could except maybe Rakan and Janna.  They aren't built to really kill anything.
> 
> Upon consideration, I think Amumu would be the best choice.  The kids would ignore him and leave.

You're right, Amumu is 100% the best choice. The children can't hurt him because of his passive damage reduction - ever see those videos where Amumu just stands and minions pile up around him? Those minions would be replaced by the five year olds in this scenario.

I think as the Darkin physical representation of war, it's highly unlikely Aatrox tires from a battle. 

If new lore hints are true as well then Aatrox is the weapon and the body is merely a tool, a puppet on strings with no need for rest.

Akali: all of them
Why?
She will become a good nurse and they will see her as a figure of authority, like a teacher.
Now the 5yo love her and she 'defeated' them all, without killing a single soul.

Mordekaiser:

Enough to raise an army.
While thinking about this, my mind segued into "how well would your main babysit 5-year-olds".
for some of these guys, that's the same question

Jhin could probably only kill 4 before he dies reloading. Even if he does get away he's only killing 4 at a time. He can't ult sense it makes him immobile and he'll just have hundreds on him before he could even get the first shot off. The traps would take out a lot, depending on how many are in the blast radius. His Q would give at least 4 of them a concussion. His W could take out a few. So my guess is probably not that many. I'll just say 4-16, at least.
Just remember, kids. If you come at him in a straight line, you deserve to die.

{{champion:202}} _"As much as I hate rushing performances, I think a situation like that calls for it."_
Build racecar Jhin, and run around at mach 2.  Can't be hurt if you can't be hit.
